New Records: Sean Manaea pitched seven-plus innings in which he was charged with three runs on three hits (two of them homers) without a walk and with six strikeouts.
Francisco Alvarez hit his fifth dinger in his past nine games.
Luisangel Acuna launched his third homer in just his eighth big league game.
Key Match Events: Sean Manaea was dominant and his offense loud enough, a three-run seventh inning making the difference in a 6-3 win over the Phillies.
Francisco Alvarez came through for a second time on the day with a perfectly placed drive into left-center for a two-run double.
Edwin Diaz struck out the potential tying run and shut down the Phillies in the ninth.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets manager, Carlos Mendoza, emphasized the importance of having a large crowd, which they received with the fifth-biggest in regular-season Citi Field history.
The team is playing like a playoff team and is threatening to play out longer than expected.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets manager, Carlos Mendoza, said that the team needed to find a way to win, and it has helped that they have found an ace in Sean Manaea.
Mendoza also said that they are planning on playing more games in October in Queens.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game had the weight and feeling of October, with a sellout crowd of 44,152 at Citi Field.
The Mets remained two games clear of the Braves in the chase for the final NL wild card.
